Title: Call env settings function once in buildlogger graphql function

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Argstruct apimodels.GetBuildloggerLogs func

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Make url query params between patch and task pages the same
Description: The query params used between patch and task page should be the same. the params passed to the queries should also be the same (where there is overlap).     This specifically relates to the sortDir param, which has a value of ASC || DESC on the patch page and 1 || -1 on the task page.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Add environment variable option to skip integration tests
Description: Almost 90% of the time I don't care about the integration tests and I don't want to populate the credentials, so I just want to skip them.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Validate that user does not spawn a virtual workstation with task data
Description: Since virtual workstations are just slightly different spawn hosts and do not have a github key to clone repositories, it would be invalid to load task data. It is still possible to do this via the UI or just a straight rest request.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: If code-server goes down return an explanation to the client

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Omit Jasper splunk credentials for virtual workstations
Description: Virtual workstation hosts (and probably spawn hosts in general) shouldn't get these credentials.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Task table shouldn't push default query params to URL
Description: currently the task table component pushes default query params to the URL if invalid query param values for the task table. The task table should not push default query params to the URL and infer the correct parameters internally

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Make statuses param in patchTasks resolver optional

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Problems in performance graph displays
Description: Some graphs are showing artifacts and may be trying to connect the results from different thread levels.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Loading skeleton for task page tabs
Description: add the loading skeleton for the task page tabs

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: sys-perf benchmarks return could not find task on base commit
Description: sys-perf has started using generate.tasks, which appears to interact poorly with historical data. This link https://evergreen.mongodb.com/plugin/json/history/sys_perf_linux_standalone_validate_cmd_patch_aef7cbf49c396df95c02606a9e94d26c892e53ed_5e72767c1e2d17595813fb53_20_03_18_19_52_18/perf returned could not find task on base commit, presumably because the task didn't exist at all in the base commit. We should see if it's possible to have the logic to look back past base commits even if the task doesn't exist.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Spawn host display names
Description: Add a display name to spawn hosts that user's can change to something more memorable than instance ids.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Patch page: metadata loading & error states
Description: Right now the entire patch page renders error if there was an error. Change so that only components that consume errored query show an error display.     Show loading states for patch header and metadata

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Patch page: schedule patch tasks mutation
Description: The schedule button on the patch page calls modify version to schedule all tasks    in legacy UI, clicking schedule all tasks on patch page makes a PUT request to [/version/\{versionId}|https://evergreen.mongodb.com/version/5e727e7932f41772e1594452] with a req payload of

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Virtual workstation home volume device name isn't set
Description: When we attach a volume to the instance we should pass the distro's home volume device name to AWS.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Intent host IDs sent to DescribeInstances API
Description: This is a problem, because it causes Evergreen to exceed its API limit, which prevents it performing other operations. Evergreen did this 5000 times in a 1-hour period https://mongodb.splunkcloud.com/en-US/app/search/search?q=search%20index%3Devergreen%20client%3D%22%5C*cloud.awsClientImpl%22%20message%3D%22AWS%20API%20call%22%20metadata.level%3D70%20%20api_name%3DDescribeInstances%20InvalidInstanceID.Malformed&earliest=1584547200&latest=1584550800&display.page.search.mode=verbose&dispatch.sample_ratio=1&sid=1584554969.4654267.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Handle AZs that don't support the instance type in Fleet requests
Description: Some AZs don't support all instance types. If a distro's instance type isn't supported by an AZ we should exclude that AZ from Fleet requests (by way of its subnet ID) for instances of that distro, or at least catch the error and not retry.   One possibility is to get the list of supported instance types for an AZ [through the API|https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sdk-for-go/api/service/ec2/#EC2.DescribeInstanceTypeOfferings] (and probably cache it somewhere)

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Investigate finding distros by ID in all usages
Description: A bunch of calls to find distros by ID should probably support usage of aliases, but they have to be handled on a case-by-case basis.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Handle distro aliases when checking distro permission scopes
Description: When distros are deleted, the distro IDs used to check permissions should go to their aliased distro instead of the deleted distro.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Display task BFGs should link to failing execution tasks' logs
Description: Since [EVG-7304|https://jira.mongodb.org/browse/EVG-7304] a single BFG is created for all test failures in a display task.   We should change the task log links to point to execution tasks' logs since the display task has no logs.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: A display task was finished before it actually finished
Description: A display task had two execution tasks that timed out. We logged an event for the display task finishing before the second execution task timed out.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Decommission idle hosts of deleted distros
Description: The idle hosts query relies on finding distros that exist. However, for hosts whose distros have been deleted (e.g. for distro aliases), these hosts also have to be decommissioned.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Handle distro aliases in host.create
Description: Currently there's no handling of distro aliases in the host.create command.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Revendor amboy with new management interface

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Noop new agent downloads from monitor if instance is going to shut down
Description: On an AWS host, if the instance is going to shut down, the monitor should not download a new agent. The agent has likely exited due to detecting that the instance is going to shut down. Instead of exiting the monitor, simply noop the download and setup, since having code that exits the monitor is potentially risky.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Do not create tickets for system-unresponsive tasks
Description: System-unresponsive tasks do not require human investigation, so we should not create tickets for them. Only setup, system, and failed tasks should create tickets.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Shut down agent before AWS shuts down spot instance
Description: Poll this endpoint on AWS hosts https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/aws/new-ec2-spot-instance-termination-notices/ and exit the agent if the endpoint returns that the host is going to be terminated. This should ensure that the agent does not report a failed or system failed status to the app server. Instead we will rely on the app server cleaning up this task to mark it system unresponsive.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Download working directory from spawn from task
Description: The linked tickets describe preserving and restoring the working directory from tasks. Another use case is restoring the directory to a spawn host in order to debug a failure.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Do not show validation warnings for distro aliases
Description: If you run {{evergreen validate}} on a config containing a distro alias for distros/run_on, it will give warnings about a nonexistent distro even though the distro alias exists. It shouldn't give warnings for using a distro alias.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: TestResultsFilterSortPaginate should use db query instead of aggregation
Description: Duration in projection may not be available to sort functions if you convert to query directly.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Lobster json pretty printing goes away with scroll
Description: Scroll around the one bookmark here with the json pretty printing on to understand: https://logkeeper.mongodb.org/lobster/build/56e19e8ab9e7042a85b559a81a5be69b/test/5e6ab05c9041301fc71f79bd#bookmarks=53211&l=1

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Update versions and tasks test data
Description: this is so we can render the task table in the patches page

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Add newline for distro aliases listed in CLI
Description: It needs whitespace or the first alias is printed on the same line.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Add AWS credentials for S3 push to agent
Description: The agent needs the credentials to push task directories to S3. This should probably go in the environment for the agent setup.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Disable autofill in distro page
Description: This is annoying and tends to save your autofill password in plaintext to the database.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Log event when host allocator changes static host status
Description: This is convenient for tracking events such as transitioning between running and quarantined/terminated.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Logs url from API is wrong
Description: The Build Baron worker occasionally fails to download logs to search for failures. Looking into one of these failures, it seems like we are getting the wrong log URL from the API. It does seem to occur when there have been multiple executions of the task and we are looking at an execution that may not be the latest.    For example, [This task|https://evergreen.mongodb.com/rest/v2/tasks/mongodb_mongo_v4.4_enterprise_debian10_64_jstestfuzz_concurrent_replication_continuous_stepdown_flow_control_09_enterprise_debian10_64_340ddb282a92bb5e97d0c43b7d44c26ec7d8da0e_20_03_10_13_18_27?fetch_all_executions=1]. Looking at the first executions, all the logs seem to append an extra _0 to the task id in the URL, which makes the links invalid. The log to the system log is: https://evergreen.mongodb.com/task_log_raw/mongodb_mongo_v4.4_enterprise_debian10_64_jstestfuzz_concurrent_replication_continuous_stepdown_flow_control_09_enterprise_debian10_64_340ddb282a92bb5e97d0c43b7d44c26ec7d8da0e_20_03_10_13_18_27_0/0?type=S

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Commit queue sends notifications to the wrong item
Description: Recently when an item in the queue finishes processing the queue sends a notification to the next item in the queue that hasn't even started processing yet and not for the item that finished processing.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Task Groups with max_hosts:1 sending tasks to two different hosts
Description: https://github.com/10gen/mms/blob/master/.evergreen.yml#L7387-L7399    name: java_dep_analysis_group    max_hosts: 1    setup_group:      - func: fetch source      - command: subprocess.exec        type: setup        params:          binary: mms/scripts/init_virtualenv.sh          args: [${workdir}, no-om]    setup_group_can_fail_task: true    tasks:      - JAVA_ANALYSIS_JDEPS      - JAVA_ANALYSIS_CYCLES    JDEPS task creates main_deps.txt file, which I verified by downloading it from where it uploads it to s3.  But CYCLES task doesn't find it anymore on disk  bash: line 3: main_deps.txt: No such file or directory    https://evergreen.mongodb.com/task/mms_java_dep_analysis_JAVA_ANALYSIS_CYCLES_a7b53c0b16a3aa91531099691254cef97502e85c_20_03_11_16_44_45    Seems to send these tasks to two different hosts. Has done this consistently for 4 version at this point in time.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Lobster's log substitution of large numbers can lose precision
Description: BSON has a NumberLong type, a 64-bit integer. The lobster log conversion presumably treats MongoDBs attribute map as JSON which likely parses all numbers into a floating point value. Large 64-bit numbers can then lose precision.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Fix build cache blocked update for display tasks

It doesn't take into account that execution tasks aren't part of the build log, and the update fails. MarkEnd returns [here|https://github.com/evergreen-ci/evergreen/blob/55a8bc51f4ceb678a7bf60d73197489529bc51d8/model/task_lifecycle.go#L440] and doesn't complete so the [build cache update for status|https://github.com/evergreen-ci/evergreen/blob/55a8bc51f4ceb678a7bf60d73197489529bc51d8/model/task_lifecycle.go#L451] doesn't run.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Host should send instance metadata to app server
Description: EC2 hosts can make requests to the instance metadata service for things that are currently populated by the cloud host ready job (mostly the hostname/IP address). If we make the request on the instance during user data provisioning (or during agent startup), we can avoid making DescribeInstances calls on the app servers to reduce our API request calls.

A    lthough these are not a problem at the moment, if the number of these queries grow, they could potentially slow other queries in the system. We should find out the source of these queries and remove or improve them. I've attached a screenshot of an example query.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Allow copy_redacted_variables to also copy all variables
Description: maybe turn it into copy_variables and have an option to include_redacted    the include redacted option will have the same limitation of needing to be admin of the projects etc.    we want to be able to copy all params from one project to another.  we take the following steps:  1. get both projects  2. delete variables that are only in the target project  3. call the update project with the json object that is source_project[variables][vars]  4. call the copy_redacted_variables api.    it would be nicer to just call  /project/source/copy_variables/target?copy_redacted=true    it would also be nice if in dry run mode it will return a json response that, if ran - would in theory do the copy  this way we can dry run - save the result JSON. go over it and see it does what we expect it to do, and then just run update_project with the json file we have.    (I realize that since redacted variables are involved, this is maybe not possible)

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Commit queue should refuse to enqueue an empty patch
Description: If a user tries to add an empty commit queue item to a queue (such as if they pause the item and then enqueue it later without adding any modules) they should get an error.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Project Triggers are using the wrong commit
Description: When a build is triggered from a different project, the commit for the trigger is not used. Instead, an old commit, likely the one that's coupled to the latest commit of the repo for the current project is used. See [this link|https://evergreen.mongodb.com/version/sys_perf_3b279bd75f946b46ad62273a66c3e9d0d6826cc0_81c90ce411305bde898e0a69d2a6479d] and the attached screenshot for as an example.    I'm marking this ticket as P2 since it seems to affect the behavior of project triggers across the board. Feel free to reprioritize or ping me if this is a project-specific issue.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Invalid statuses sent by agent in error scenarios
Description: https://github.com/evergreen-ci/evergreen/commit/a79ab08cd2beb6cc08eebcca4df388232ce06c8a#diff-6ea70e0a4de93ebcb83000a028edc163R328 added 2 scenarios in which the agent tries to post system-failed as the status, but not in the right format. I attempted to fix this by changing the status, but that caused some test failures I wasn't able to explain so it's been reverted

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Add priority to notifications
Description: We should add a priority field to notifications and sort on it when we pull the next batch of unprocessed notifications. This will help address commit queue notifications not being processed.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Evergreen error status being sent to PRs
Description: Evergreen sometimes processes patch intents for PRs twice. The first time around sends an ok status to GitHub, and the second sends an error status because we try to insert the patch again.     The user only sees the second GitHub status because GitHub only displays the latest status on a commit.

Description: I have no clue if this will work but might as well try? This will cause user data hosts to go down a special case path, which I don't love but it might reduce the number of AWS calls.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Replace DescribeInstances with instance metadata
Description: We can save on DescribeInstances calls (and avoid API limits) by getting the data about the instance from [instance metadata|https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/ec2-instance-metadata.html] from within the agent and posting it back to Evergreen. This would also effectively remove the need for the setup host job to run for user data.

Description: When using the Perf Baron pages, some of the filter cells have defaults when they are empty (e.g.the create time defaults to 2 weeks ago).      When a value is defaulted we should set a placeholder so that it is obvious what filter is being used.

The new JSON logging format is neither, so we should make a new log processing filter that moves back in that direction for lobster and local lobster usage.  My proposal is the following.  example current log line appearance:    New transformation (which basically removes the extraneous key names and formatting characters for the common fields):

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Include log links for previous executions
Description: We got a BFG (https://jira.mongodb.org/browse/BFG-480805) for a failure of a task that has 4 executions. The BFG was specifically related to the 3rd execution. When we query the API to get the logs for that execution, they are all null (https://evergreen.mongodb.com/rest/v2/tasks/mongodb_mongo_master_enterprise_ubuntu1804_arm64_sharding_3_enterprise_ubuntu1804_arm64_f83f9dcc22156cdf3c3e16a040914806e2e17cf7_20_02_25_04_29_47?fetch_all_executions=1).    It looks like all previous executions have null for the log links. Would it be possible to include the log link in the API?

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Setting scheduler to revised-with-dependencies makes commit queue merges not get scheduled

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Agent/monitor deploy should be enqueued immediately after conversion runs
Description: This is to avoid a waiting period during which the reprovisioning host is marked as recently communicated and not needing a new agent/monitor deployed, which prevents the reprovision from starting immediately once the agent has exited. For some reason, the flag to need new agent/monitor is set when the conversion job runs, but somehow gets disabled so the deploy doesn't go out as soon as the conversion is finished.    The most likely cause is that the field gets updated, but because the agent checks in once a minute, it clears the needs new agent/monitor flag, which prevents the job from being enqueued. This might be fixed by event-driven job submission.

I'm therefore changing the status of this ticket to in code review, even though there is not code.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Fix errors on spawn host page
Description: There's a lot of errors saying {{$scope.curHostData}} is undefined.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Ensure tasks cannot be put in multiple task queues
Description: Scheduled tasks should not be able to go into multiple task queues. Otherwise, the scheduler may over-allocate hosts (which it bases off of the primary task queue lengths).

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Attempt to give task directory write permissions before removing
Description: On static hosts, many task directories are not being cleaned up because files/directories in tasks directories are set to read-only permissions. This is bad, because it's currently filling up the disk space on the mac hosts. When the agent starts up, it tries to clean up the whole directory since it has {{--cleanup}}, which can spend a substantial amount of time doing wasteful work (for example, on the latest deploy, a macos-1012 host took more than 15 minutes before it started attempting because it had 32GB of uncleaned task directories that it tried removing). During startup, there is no heartbeat to the app server during this time to tell it that the agent is alive, so after a long period of no communication, the app server might try to deploy again on top of the agent, which is actually alive but stuck in cleanup mode.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Use NaiveManager instead of MockUserManager in GQL tests
Description: The purpose of this change is to be able to access user permissions during gql query tests so we can properly test queries that require specific permissions.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Require rootdir for all Windows provisioning types
Description: Currently it's not required on legacy provisioned Windows hosts. However, it would greatly reduce the amount of complexity in specifying Windows if we used native paths to files more consistently instead of using Unix-style paths and paths relative to HOME in some (but not all) of the relevant places (excluding binaries, which must be invoked with Unix-style paths).

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Commit queue misses a nil patch
Description: If the commit queue tries to process a non-existent patch it will panic instead of dequeueing.    We should catch the [nil patch case|https://github.com/evergreen-ci/evergreen/blob/a636d364299d42dd6a710a4f4ece931ea04d50e8/units/commit_queue.go#L273] and probably {code:go}defer dequeue(){code}   too.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Add distro UI option to reprovision Jasper on all hosts on save
Description: Jasper is automatically restarted when all hosts need new credentials. However, there should be an option to mark all hosts in the distro as needing Jasper to be reprovisioned (e.g. for critical Jasper service updates). The Jasper restart job will have to get the latest curator binary for this. This restart should still have lower priority than the provisioning type conversion jobs.    Also, maybe it would be nice to have a restart button on the host page so we don't have to roll over the entire distro host fleet.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Allow downloading of very long log files
Description: Using curl (with no timeout)

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Enable CORS on evg auth endpoints
Description: The auth endpoints are the only REST endpoints that Spruce talks to (aside from the gql endpoint). These endpoints will need to allow CORS from spruce.mongodb.com to work in staging and in production.     When I first tried working on this, I ran into issues with auth not working as expected anymore. I was able to login and logout, however the user cookie was not being removed on logout. This caused tests to fail.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Support service users in Evergreen
Description: Currently Evergreen can only support a single auth method at a time. Since switching from LDAP will not allow us to bring our service users with us, we should support multiple auth methods, probably using naive auth for service users and Okta auth for human users. One possible implementation is a multi-auth provider wrapper type.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Task is blocked on duplicate dependencies
Description: A task was created with a duplicated dependency. When the depended-on task failed the three copies of the dependency were all set unattainable in the depending task. When the depended-on task was restarted and passed only the first instance of the dependency was set unattainable false in the depending task, so it's still blocked and won't run.    Arguably the main issue is the duplicated dependency.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Missing commits in the history drawer
Description: While investigating BF-16287 I went to look at the history around the first failing commit, by going here: https://evergreen.mongodb.com/task/mongodb_mongo_master_enterprise_rhel_62_64_bit_unittests_84bdc9478401355656ab7eaec745dbae2e4294cb_20_02_06_15_27_46    The 84bdc commit and the following three all show the same compile failure mode, so 84bdc was clearly at fault. But the next commit in the history drawer is green at 98159, which could not have fixed the compilation error. So how did the build go green between 9ecd5 and 98159?    There is actually another commit in between, 7a4ea, which fixed the compilation failure:        However, the this commit does not appear anywhere in the evergreen UI. This is either a UI bug, or EVG never noticed the commit at all. Either way, not being able to see the revert commit in the history drawer made diagnosing this BF very confusing.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Evergreen fetch for Windows spawn host uses incorrect path
Description: The working directory needs to be a native Windows path in order to open the file, but it's actually specified as a cygwin-style (i.e. Unix) directory path. This has not been a problem up until now because almost all files go into {{/data}}, which is fine because {{/data}} can be found at the root of the C drive as well.         This only affects legacy SSH hosts.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Add Validation to attach_artifact
Description: If a user attaches an artifact through the attach_artifact command and supplies their own link to a file, as opposed to doing it through the s3_put command, they should not be able to set Visibility to signed.    The motivation:   When a user attaches a file that way, it can be a link to GitHub, a wiki page, or any arbitrary link. Since it's not a url that we generated and uploaded to s3, we cannot sign it.     Even if the link they are provided IS an s3 link, we still can't sign it, unless we expand the params to also take in the aws key and secret that they used to upload the file with. However, in that case, if that is the functionality that they are looking for, it would make more sense for them to upload it using the s3_put command than to hack attach_artifacts to behave like s3_put with visibility set to signed.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: The BuildBaron JIRA panel in Evergreen is really slow
Description: After opening a patch build or an Evergreen run, the JIRA panel in the BuildBaron view is spinning in the Searching JIRA for tickets for several minutes and more often than not it ends up showing Searching JIRA failed. This makes it unusable, so most of the time I just copy the test name and search manually in JIRA, which takes subseconds.    Is it possible to improve the usability of the JIRA panel?

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: File one BFG per Display Task Instead of Execution Task
Description: With the Server test suites moving to execution tasks for increased parallellism, the number of BFG tickets has grown accordingly. This is caused by a couple of factors.     First, widespread failures that affect multiple tests in a suite would create X number of BFGs instead of 1.    Second, consistently failing tests are not guaranteed to run in the same execution task, due to the way the knapsack packing algorithm relies on test history information. This prevents backtracking from working and could cause more BFGs to be created for the same failure on different execution tasks

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Sys-Perf dashboad sometimes does not update when switching metrics
Description: I have been looking at this page on the Evergreen sys-perf waterfall:  [https://evergreen.mongodb.com/task/sys_perf_linux_3_node_replSet_service_architecture_workloads_a081c83758521e11a5f285541ea9f13928f3de0f_20_01_29_13_22_40##%257B%2522hiddenGraphs%2522%253A%255B%2522canary_server-cpuloop-10x%2522%252C%2522canary_client-cpuloop-1x%2522%252C%2522canary_client-cpuloop-10x%2522%252C%2522canary_server-sleep-10ms%2522%252C%2522canary_ping%2522%252C%2522fio_latency_test_write_clat_mean%2522%252C%2522fio_latency_test_read_clat_mean%2522%252C%2522fio_iops_test_write_iops%2522%252C%2522fio_iops_test_read_iops%2522%252C%2522fio_streaming_bandwidth_test_write_iops%2522%252C%2522fio_streaming_bandwidth_test_read_iops%2522%252C%2522NetworkBandwidth%2522%255D%252C%2522metric%2522%253A%2522ops_per_sec%2522%257D]    I noticed that by default, the metrics are in Ops/Sec.  !EvgOpsSec.png|thumbnail!    However, I wanted to view latency metrics. So, I switched the metric name to Latency 50th Percentile. However, the metrics did not update to the new view.  !EvgLatency50.png|thumbnail!    Even more strangely, I observe that the views refresh themselves when viewing the above link on my laptop.  !Screenshot from 2020-01-29 16-26-28.png|thumbnail!    Both machines run FireFox on Linux.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Check Commit Queue Isn't Stuck
Description: Currently, we have an email alert set up for if  processing_seconds > 3600, from the commitQueueJob. It seems like usually if a commit queue _is_ stuck, it's because a notification wasn't created for some reason.     Instead, we should (if processing_seconds is > than some constant) check if the item at the top of the queue is in fact finished, and in that case remove it.    In this case, instead of logging info, _if_ we do remove an item at the top of the queue, we should grip.Critical that we've Unstuck the queue so that we can investigate that item.

Description: Currently in the task page, it is not possible to restart it with a single click while a task is running. Instead, one has to abort, wait a while for it to successfully abort and then restart it.    Similar to the option to restart in progress tasks on the commit level page, we should provide this functionality on the task level page so folks don't have to work as hard to restart a task.    This is helpful for restarting release tasks that have some sort of system failure (e.g., 404 errors looking for packages). In the release tools, it takes a while for these failures to propagate out and the fail the task, so if I’m watching it and see the issue logged and now it’s going to be a problem then I’ll restart it.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Create first failing task in patch notification
Description: Updated text from [~<USER>:    We currently have a Patch Finish notification on https://evergreen.mongodb.com/notifications. However, this notifies the user once, when every task in a patch has finished. It would also be useful to notify a user as soon as the first task in the patch has failed. If practical, we should modify this notification type, and potentially call it Patch Outcome. Alternatively, we could create a new notification type called first failing task in patch, and users could subscribe to one or both of patch finish and first failing task in patch.     Original text from [~<USER>:    My understanding is currently PR patch builds are not treated differently from other patch builds, in the sense of deferring the determination of pass or failed upon completion of all tasks in the patch build.    Ideally, any task failure in a PR patch build will immediately mark the failure of the PR testing (without waiting for other tasks to complete), and cancel all other running tasks (to save build resource).

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Stepback of dynamic tasks doesn't work if generator was unscheduled
Description: ...because it passed in a later revision.    But if the later version of the generatED task fails, there will be nothing to step back to in the previous version because those tasks weren't generated.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Single command to backport a commit (for low-risk backports)
Description: Most backports are mechanical. You cherry-pick the commit, it applies cleanly, you run a patch build, it goes green, you push it to the commit queue. Backports would be a lot less painful if there were one cli command or one button we could click to backport a commit and do all of these steps automatically. If the patch build doesn't go green, it doesn't mean the process needs to abort, the user could be alerted that they need to approve the patch build as effectively green (no failures related to the backport) and then the backport would get pushed to the commit queue from there. This would be especially useful if continuously delivery means we start backporting more commits. The process should only be manual if the cherry pick does not apply cleanly.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Support cron-like syntax for batch time
Description: Currently batch time is confusing, because it is based on when the previous run of a variant occurred. This means that if a variant has a 24-hour batch time, and it previously ran at 3am every night, if someone schedules a variant at 12pm, batch time will switch to when this variant runs.    To accomplish this I believe we will need to do two things. If this seems like more than 4 points of work, the implementer of this ticket should split one of the below into a separate ticket:    # Support a cron-like syntax in the project file. There is likely a library for this.  # Add support for this cron-like behavior to the version activation catchup job.    The docs for this should include that this behavior is the time zone of the Evergreen app servers, i.e., UTC.

It's hard to know how a project could have been created without [also inserting projectVars|https://github.com/evergreen-ci/evergreen/blob/f036124c01bd7de98e2b03e660636d08634a6fe9/service/project.go#L636].

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Commit queue set-module won't use the description argument
Description: Since the message flag was removed (https://github.com/evergreen-ci/evergreen/commit/8f99d8f744f39051ee6fd5338ce977e15483b4a6) pulling the message flag from the context will get the empty string.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Prevent using regular patch and set-module commands for commit queue patches
Description: Users should not be able to create a commit queue patch with the regular patch command.   Also, if a module is added with the regular set-module command the message will be empty and the commit will fail. We should error if a user does this.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Mark task as failed if task uploads empty xunit results
Description: Sometimes we had a bug in the test runner where no tests would run, the runner would exit with a status of 0, and syntactically valid empty XML test results would be uploaded, and the task would seem to pass, but actually it wasn't doing anything.    It would be helpful if Evergreen could catch these kinds of mistakes at a lower level, such that if a task uploads xunit XML test results file, but there are not actually any test cases run, the task would actually be marked as failing.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Sys Perf trend charts in patchbuilds can misorder results
Description: In this [patchbuild|https://evergreen.mongodb.com/task/sys_perf_linux_standalone_audit_industry_benchmarks_patch_58abcf6577982367232a6c76d1ee277a4031ed3c_5dead5740ae6060c325daab9_19_12_06_22_26_35##%257B%2522compare%2522%253A%255B%257B%2522hash%2522%253A%252258abcf6577982367232a6c76d1ee277a4031ed3c%2522%257D%255D%257D], the output was rendered on the far left of the trend chart. The patchbuild was performed December 6th 2019 off of a recent commit. However, the visualization places it near patches from 2018.    Placing the results for the patchbuild far away from related results makes it more difficult to visualize changes.    This commit:   !image-2019-12-17-09-55-56-482.png|thumbnail!     The next commit:   !image-2019-12-17-09-56-28-389.png|thumbnail!

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Remove TaskOrdering from code
Description: ubuntu1604-test is running the new tunable scheduler. I observed that a patch was at the top of the queue https://evergreen.mongodb.com/version/5df10c3030661525ab8d4acf, followed by all the tasks for this mainline commit https://evergreen.mongodb.com/version/mongodb_mongo_v3.6_919b7c1ce02104a22a06b14016d152440f66161d, followed by all the tasks in other patches https://evergreen.mongodb.com/version/5df112e2a4cf47113ff144d7.    This is unexpected because I would expect interleave, which is what, to interleave patch and mainline commits.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Add the ability to limit specific distros to certain projects
Description: There are cases where a certain distro is created specifically for a project. We should add a feature to prevent other projects from using that distro.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Add a notes field to distros
Description: We have created more custom distros which have very specific use cases. If you don't have a knowledge of the history of the distro, it's easy to change distro settings in a way that breaks implicit assumptions about how the distro will be used. We should add a notes field to the distro, visible in the UI, so that administrators can record facts about the distros.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Task directories not being cleaned up between tasks
Description: Windows agents are failing to clean up their task directories and leave behind files between tasks.    Example errors in agent logs:    {{agent-3424-14.log:[evergreen.agent] 2019/12/13 17:57:46 [p=critical]: Error removing working directory for the task: \data\mci\24b47f5b24b3be8ac822dea79146ea26: remove \data\mci\24b47f5b24b3be8ac822dea79146ea26\mms\server\build\java\classes\com\xgen\svc\mms\api\view\atlas_private\dataLake: The directory is not empty.}}   {{agent-3424-16.log:[evergreen.agent] 2019/12/13 18:15:22 [p=critical]: Error removing working directory for the task: \data\mci\5d8f220a77d23a59aba3912c4a97d73f: remove \data\mci\5d8f220a77d23a59aba3912c4a97d73f\mms\server\build\java\classes\com\xgen\svc\mms\api\view\atlas_private\dataLake: The directory is not empty.}}   {{agent-3424-18.log:[evergreen.agent] 2019/12/13 18:33:11 [p=critical]: Error removing working directory for the task: \data\mci\4b701a6ca0f7fbaac61a430895e05133: remove \data\mci\4b701a6ca0f7fbaac61a430895e05133\mms\server\build\java\classes\com\xgen\svc\mms\api\view\atlas_private\dataLake: The directory is not empty.}}         There is also a related issue where a Windows agent is cleaning up a task directory but then stops communicating with the app server, causing the app server to attempt to deploy agents/agent monitors to the host when the agent is still running.         This applies to both non-legacy and legacy provisioning on Windows machines. I checked on windows-64-vs2013-small and windows-64-vs2015-compile and both had this issue.         Example of a legacy host (windows-64-2019) in production that had this issue: https://evergreen.mongodb.com/host/i-00807d0b61df6bdfc         I quarantined some hosts in staging that seem to have this issue (using legacy provisioning). I'm unsure if they're the same issue but they have the same symptom of not being able to clean up the task directory:    [https://evergreen-staging.corp.mongodb.com/host/i-035a2aab525bd8c77]    [https://evergreen-staging.corp.mongodb.com/host/i-0218a3aa604dbfa88]

Title: Allow metric selection in perf discovery

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Also persist parser project in generate tasks
Description: At the point of starting this ticket, parser project write not read should be deployed, but without a generate task step. We should figure out the best way to write to parser project during generate tasks without causing a race.    Possibly what we'll want to do is persist the ParserProject in Save() with whatever ConfigUpdateNumber we have, but in LoadProjectFromVersion only use the parser project if the ConfigUpdateNumber >= the version's ConfigUpdateNumber (in the case it's outdated, re-parse and save using the version config string).

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Host that does not come up can cause all host provisioning to fail
Description: At 6:07pm EST on 12/09/19, a user requested spawn host i-0489a525d49f1af12. This spawn host hit the [host not ready for setup|https://github.com/evergreen-ci/evergreen/blob/f50768d851142375ee202210e4f6424128199c79/units/host_status.go#L130] case from 6:08pm to 7:10pm, suggesting either that it's possible for a host to get stuck in some pending status or that there is some failed status that Evergreen does not handle correctly.    After the hour passed, AWS no longer returned data about that host. This caused Evergreen to [return early|https://github.com/evergreen-ci/evergreen/blob/f50768d851142375ee202210e4f6424128199c79/cloud/ec2.go#L724] from GetInstanceStatuses, because that host was no longer included in the DescribeInstances response.    This in turn blocked on host provisioning that went through that DescribeInstances code path. Since fleet is its own provider, most task hosts did come up, but hosts spawned by users, hosts spawned by host.create, and on-demand hosts (i.e., perf) did not. We fixed this in production by terminating all on-demand hosts older than 1 hour.    One possible fix for this is to terminate a host in the database if it is not included in the DescribeInstances response. Another is to figure out the additional case we are failing to handle in setCloudHostStatus.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: evg-lint needs to handle nolint
Description: It must be able to handle nolint comment directives as part of migration to golangci-lint instead of gometalinter. golangci-lint does not have easy integration with custom linters because it does not support running linter binaries.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Change the TAG API to be part of the update project API (or at least similar to it)
Description: There are a few reasons to ask for this:    1. someone may want to add/remove more than a single tag.  2. someone may want to change from one tag to another (would require two calls instead of a single call with {tags: ['new'], tags_to_remove: [old]}  3. most likely someone may want to already make some other changes to a project in addition to changing its tags. This way a single update call can be used to make all the required changes.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Fix static host reprovisioning to legacy and tune job enqueueing
Description: Fix various issues:  * If we're converting a static host to legacy provisioning, it has to be able to use a Jasper client to stop the agent monitor.  * The host event page has the wrong event type name.  * Jobs should be rounded to the nearest minute for uniqueness to allow provisioning to be changed multiple times per hour. Otherwise, the host will have to wait until the next deploy to be reprovisioned.  * Needs new agent/monitor should be checked only after the job is locked.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Include version requester type in rest v2 endpoint
Description: An ETL job was relying on URLs to determine whether something was a patch build. An object ID is a patch build, while something with a project name prepended to an object ID is a mainline build. This is awkward, and it now has broken, since periodic builds look like patch builds.    We should provide the version requester type itself in the rest v2 endpoint for versions. The list of types is here: https://github.com/evergreen-ci/evergreen/blob/13546d429c9c218b5024b0d329004db52fab7d01/globals.go#L300-L306.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Github push webhook got 400 response for non-tracked branches
Description: After turning on Pushes event in the Evergreen webhook ([https://evergreen.mongodb.com/rest/v2/hooks/github)] for the wiredtiger/wiredtiger repository on Github, I saw 400 responses returned from Evergreen for push events associated to branches that are not tracked by Evergreen (i.e. branches that have no Evergreen project to test against). It is actually quite usual push events being generated from those short-lived feature branches for pull request changes. And the 400 response code feels a bit misleading as well.          It would be nice if Evergreen could tolerate push events from those non-tracked branches with a positive response code.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Create variables that are never logged
Description: Create a new kind of variable that is like a redacted variable but is restricted to a subset of commands that do not permit the user to leak the variable. This means that commands like {{shell.exec}}, {{subprocess.exec}}, and {{expansions.write}} should not have access to this kind of variable. {{s3.get}} and {{s3.put}} should have access to this kind of variable.    The use case for this is for teams to be able to provide variables that cannot be inadvertently discovered by users running patch builds. See the developers-only comments for details about the use case.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: evergreen fetch needs to clone as unprivileged user
Description: User data runs as root, but we want it to actually run as the user defined in the distro settings. This will prevent issues with cloning repositories, which requires the github SSH keys.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Host should be marked running even if evergreen fetch fails to get task data
Description: Hosts should not have fetching task data be required to be considered 'running'. A spawn host that is supposed to be loaded with task data might fail at {{evergreen fetch}}, but should still be marked as running. This is the current legacy SSH behavior.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: JasperClient should not generate Jasper credentials
Description: After the certdepot refactor, [this line|https://github.com/evergreen-ci/evergreen/blob/50df9cd27639e7e3cd0962ab5c22ef3cf96f9dcf/model/host/hostutil.go#L739] deletes the current Jasper credentials for a host that is already assumed to be running Jasper. *This is incorrect because it will delete the host's Jasper credentials and replace them with new ones, causing a data inconsistency between the host's Jasper credentials on disk and the app server's copy of the credentials.*

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: amazon1-linux distros do not have /usr/local/bin in PATH

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Undispatchable display tasks are stuck in the task_queue when when running with evergreen.DispatcherVersionRevisedWithDependencies
Description: [~<USER> - as discussed in person yesterday:    Here is an arbitrary _task\_queue_ which contains 52 tasks over 24 hours old.          Some of the _tasks_ that we inspected, you identified as (undispatchable) display tasks, e.g.:    https://evergreen.mongodb.com/task/mongodb_mongo_v4.2_enterprise_ubuntu1604_64_aggregation_multiversion_fuzzer_5_enterprise_ubuntu1604_64_1006ba7736ec24da479de805c7777e63315711fb_19_11_06_19_34_42    We need to address this particular subset of undispatchable tasks remaining in the queue.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Reduce host cycling when using evergreen.DispatcherVersionRevisedWithDependencies
Description: When running with _evergreen.DispatcherVersionRevisedWithDependencies_ It is possible for a single _depends_on_ task to block a significant number (or all) the tasks present in the _task_queue_ if they are dependent on this single task.    For example, at one point every task (33 tasks) in the _archlinux-test_ _task_queue_ were blocked from being dispatched as they all had a _depends_on_ for the same dispatched/running task:    While waiting for this _depends_on_ task to complete, the _host_allocator_ is cycling hosts for work that cannot be dispatched as the length of the _task_queue_ is a factor in determining how many hosts to provision.    We should try to minimise, and ideally avoid this scenario.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: ubuntu1404 missing HOME environment variable
Description: Other distros (e.g. rhel70, ubuntu1604) were confirmed to have an agent with the HOME environment variable set. This is an issue with upstart not providing some common environment variables like $SHELL, $USER, $HOME, etc. Systemd [already provides HOME as an environment variable|https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd.exec.html#Environment%20variables%20in%20spawned%20processes].    These can probably be pulled from {{/etc/passwd}}.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Disallow `evergreen cancel-patch` on commit queue patches
Description: Using `evergreen cancel-patch` on a commit queue patch appears to cause the queue to become stuck. The patch was not found at the URL (at /patches/<id>), but it was nevertheless present in the queue array for that project in the commit_queue collection.

This does not occur if you curl the binary through SSH.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: rhel76-test spawn host authorized_keys is incorrect
Description: One spawn host (i-091488ba317364495) had its public key cut off. The cloud-init logs are unusual in that they don't show the user data script execution.    I can reproduce this on rhel70-small and rhel76-test, but not ubuntu1804-build.    One guess I have is that, given that it seems to be confined to rhel and only occurs occasionally, the awssshkey service is trying to write to the file concurrently with the user data script. Redirects might be atomic [if writes are small enough|https://linux.die.net/man/3/write].

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: variant_tasks in patches endpoint contains all tasks
Description: I was looking at the data returned by the patches endpoint, [/rest/v2/projects/<project>/patches|https://evergreen.mongodb.com/rest/v2/projects/mongodb-mongo-master/patches]. One section of the data is variants_tasks, I assume that this is supposed to be which tasks are being run in each build variant. However, all of the tasks appear in each variant, which greatly reduces the value of this data (we already have all the variants and all the tasks in other parts of the data).    This seems like a bug. It seems like each entry should only list the tasks that are contained in that variant.    Here is an example from a server commit-queue patch:      The lint tasks only exist in the 'enterprise-rhel-62-64-bit' variant, so seeing them in the 'commit-queue' variant is surprising. And the 'compile_core_tools' and 'commit_queue_placeholder' only exist in the 'commit-queue' variant.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Evaluate passing around of contextual information
Description: Currently there is a small amount of prop drilling to pass the API client through components: https://github.com/evergreen-ci/spruce/blob/ca6936592568a602cf096aaf7c78653f24e9b8ee/src/components/patch/Patch.tsx#L26. Separately there is a user context that is not currently used much, but will be once we have an actual authentication system: https://github.com/evergreen-ci/spruce/blob/master/src/components/login/Login.tsx#L22. Additionally we'll likely be adding the current project context as some sort of state that is persisted in the client. We should figure out a clean way to manage this state and pass through to API requests.    This is roughly the client analogue to the handlers for contextual information we have in middleware: https://github.com/evergreen-ci/evergreen/blob/4197faecce34751f7d55c4766c2a22323943c972/service/middleware.go#L35

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Embedded task ordering issue
Description: Looking at this patch build: https://evergreen.mongodb.com/build/mongodb_mongo_master_embedded_sdk_android_x86_64_patch_4403da71126ea32e37f059ce848898dfab22f720_5db259d632f4173e9269dbfe_19_10_25_02_12_34    The first execution of this install_dev task ran before its required prerequisite, the build_cdriver phase:    - https://evergreen.mongodb.com/task/mongodb_mongo_master_embedded_sdk_android_x86_64_embedded_sdk_install_dev_patch_4403da71126ea32e37f059ce848898dfab22f720_5db259d632f4173e9269dbfe_19_10_25_02_12_34/0##%257B%2522compare%2522%253A%255B%257B%2522hash%2522%253A%25224403da71126ea32e37f059ce848898dfab22f720%2522%257D%255D%257D    - https://evergreen.mongodb.com/task/mongodb_mongo_master_embedded_sdk_android_x86_64_embedded_sdk_build_cdriver_patch_4403da71126ea32e37f059ce848898dfab22f720_5db259d632f4173e9269dbfe_19_10_25_02_12_34##%257B%2522compare%2522%253A%255B%257B%2522hash%2522%253A%25224403da71126ea32e37f059ce848898dfab22f720%2522%257D%255D%257D    Though they did run on the same machine. The restart of the install_dev task ran on a different machine:    - https://evergreen.mongodb.com/task/mongodb_mongo_master_embedded_sdk_android_x86_64_embedded_sdk_install_dev_patch_4403da71126ea32e37f059ce848898dfab22f720_5db259d632f4173e9269dbfe_19_10_25_02_12_34##%257B%2522compare%2522%253A%255B%257B%2522hash%2522%253A%25224403da71126ea32e37f059ce848898dfab22f720%2522%257D%255D%257D    So it seems there are some lingering dependency ordering issues. Perhaps we need to (or now can) specify dependencies among the various embedded tasks now that other evergreen issues are fixed?    While the embedded builders are probably going to be torn down, the ability to sequence dependent tasks that will run on the same machine is important to future projects to improve server build performance.    CC [~<USER> and [~<USER>

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Add feature to bump a commit queue merge request to the top of the queue
Description: With the commit queue, the build can be broken for longer. Sometimes the Build Baron wishes to revert a commit in order to fix the build, but that commit must wait for the rest of the queue to be processed.    This feature will be a flag, which, at commit queue item submission time, will put this item at the top of the queue. Explicitly out of scope is reordering the queue in any other way or putting the new item behind the other higher-priority items.    We will not in this ticket create an authorization mechanism for this feature. Instead, we should log each time this happens so that we can audit abuses of this feature if they occur.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Staging hosts not marked as externally terminated
Description: The hosts (i-0100d98816ddbc085 and i-06167e9cabc05bd0b) were reclaimed by AWS but for some reason the host was marked as needing a new agent monitor. This started the agent monitor deploy job, which updates the LCT and prevented the external termination job from running.         The host alerting job indicated that the host was running a task for a long time but the running task was cleared before the host could be checked for external termination.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: It is possible to enable the commit queue with no variants and tasks
Description: We should not create commit queue versions if there are no variants and tasks. (Validation is probably not sufficient, because a person could add variant and task regexes, but those regexes might not pick out existing variants and tasks.) If a commit queue version is created with no variants and tasks, it will block the queue, since it will never be dequeued.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Apparent multiple execution of generate.tasks jobs
Description: Consider this task https://evergreen.mongodb.com/task/mongodb_mongo_master_enterprise_rhel_62_64_bit_display_sharding_ese_patch_b3b494a72f0e19d7556bee627da7ae9b79e26a03_5dadc8ef30661551b09da831_19_10_21_15_04_43. (There are many similar examples in that version.) The generator clearly finished, since it generated tasks. However, there is an error that returns early, which suggests there must have been multiple executions.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Fix permissions on evergreen host setup
Description: In the setup script, {{/data}} is owned by root and all subdirectories obey its umask. Root's umask prevents setting options to give write permission to user subdirectories in other. The setup command should either not be run or should be run as the distro user.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: triggered builds should not be created in deactived projects

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Update testresults schema to support efficient hourly and daily test stats generation
Description: As an evergreen engineer,  I want testresults to contain extra fields,  So that the hourly / daily test stats aggregations can use $merge as efficiently as possible.    ----  AC:  * testresults will be amended to add the following extra fields:   ** branch (the project)   ** build_variant   ** distro   ** r (requester)   **  display_name, the task display name   ** execution_display_name, the execution task display name (can be null or missing).   ** create_time, the task create time.    ----

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Map groups to roles
Description: Create some sort of data structure in the admin collection that maps LDAP groups for a user (stored in the SystemRoles of the user model) to roles (roles collection). Also create an API to update/create a role mapping

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Cannot update host expiration date
Description: I would like to update my spawn host's expiration date. However, when I select a new date, I am told that the expiration date was updated to the existing expiration date (tomorrow).  !Screen Shot 2019-10-18 at 9.26.22 AM.png|width=100%!

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Delete nonexistent windows-64-vs2017-compile-m5 from self-tests

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Support user data provisioning on Windows
Description: There are a few outstanding issues with user data at the moment:   # User data runs as LocalSystem and cannot perform some of the setup script actions like mounting EBS volumes due to ACL issues.   # The user data script still hangs and never finishes.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Commit Queue doesn't allow submitting as someone else
Description: Currently the commit queue doesn't allow submitting a commit with someone else as the author. This breaks the worfklow we have for accepting [external pull requests|https://wiki.corp.mongodb.com/display/KERNEL/How+We+Handle+Pull+Requests] as external users can no longer be the author of any MongoDB commits. We need a way to allow specifying a different author.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Agent deploys jobs should not wait until MaxLCT elapses to attempt redeploy
Description: Currently, if a deploy fails on an SSH command, it will not set the needs new agent flag, which is used to determine if the agent still needs to be deployed. Therefore, if SSH fails (the most likely thing to fail in the job), it will have to wait until MaxLCT elapses (5 mins) before attempting to deploy again. This wastes host compute minutes and increases the likelihood that the host will be idle terminated.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Provide a way to download a subset of the logs
Description: Often on test timeouts the logs have hundreds of thousands of lines, but only the first few thousand or first hundred thousand are helpful. Sometimes the logs are even too long to download at all. It would be great if there were a way to download the raw logs for the first n lines, and/or a way for the lobster view to only download the first n lines.     CC [~<USER> and [~jason.chan]

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: All agents on macos-1014 were hung

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: add gocache to agent environment variable.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Retry agent deploys for longer, to avoid quarantining hosts

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Set GOCACHE to task directory
Description: We see static hosts running out of disk space and in most cases go cache folder is the biggest offender.  We talked to a few project owners about setting GOCACHE in their project to task's temp dir and they did it but it looks like there are more projects and it feels we're playing whack-a-mole here.    Brian and Sam said we can do this on the agent level.  Let's please set this to task's temp dir.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Generate and Validate Device name
Description: Currently has to be specified by the user via commandline. Per Thomas' comment:    With this new struct, it should be easier to validate the device name specified by the user when attaching volumes using the Volumes field of the struct and the guidelines here: [https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/device_naming.html] (we should loop through the possibilities and assign the first device name that isn't taken!).

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: commit-queue support git commit specification syntax
Description: It would be really nice if commit-queue could take a parameter that allowed me to specify which commit to submit, a la the SPECIFYING REVISIONS section in gitrevisions(7) man page.  Then I would be able to do something like:    And this would work even if that particular commit wasn't at the HEAD of my local tree and there were other differences in my tree compared to upstream.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Turn on the DAG dispatcher and Tunable Planner in production (Take 2)

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Allow SSH config to persist when stopping/starting instances
Description: It seems like stopping and starting a host (which is different from rebooting) wipes the instance store where host setup scripts create an SSH config folder. In order for users to be able to connect to their spawn hosts after stopping/starting them (for use cases like modifying instance type), we need to make the SSH config persist on the instance.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Remove string buildvariants for patches
Description: Buildvariants should now be passed in the patch submission request (i.e. {{evergreen patch}}) as a string slice instead of string of comma-separated buildvariant names. However, users must first update their evergreen binaries, so they should be given a grace period to update before switching to the new JSON payload.

Description: https://github.com/evergreen-ci/evergreen/blob/06d4d0ebac0602152942984337de11edb3aeff00/service/version.go#L98 is definitely wrong, and there may be others

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Collect unsent notification stats for the CLI commit queue
Description: Add the subscriber type to the switch statement.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Collect stats on hosts that never finish provisioning
Description: Hosts that are provisioned with user data will never indicate that they are running until the agent starts. If they fail to start for any reason, this should be tracked in Splunk. Currently, the idle host job will only run on hosts that managed to start the agent. More useful would be the ability to track hosts that were started in EC2 but never managed to start an agent.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Create a list volumes command
Description: There should be a command available through the CLI (perhaps evergreen host list-volumes) that lists a user's volumes. This should include ID, size, type, and a host ID if the volume is attached to a host.

Description: This would be useful for tracking host utilization by provisioning type (legacy vs new).

Description: They have a mismatch of the event type and the object in the selectors

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Filters sometimes don't work in Spruce
Description: If a filter which is not the first in the list is applied and then cleared subsequent filters don't work for collapsed patches.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Add dependencies check prior to dispatching a task via the Revised Dispatcher
Description: In an ideal world we should never have to check dependencies prior to dispatching a task via the _Revised Dispatcher_.     This guard maintains the desired dependency relationships (and associated task dispatch ordering) in case the independent _task_finder_ stage adds tasks with unsatisfied dependencies to the _task_queue_.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Rate Limit Host Creation
Description: Host creation is supposed only create 16 hosts at a time, but doesn't because of a bug where the count is not incremented.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering

Description: If the event-metajob is interrupted after an event is marked processed the NewEventNotificationJob will not make it to the database and the event will not be processed by the next event-metajob run.    Assess the feasibility of moving MarkProcessed to after the event is dispatched.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Add Alert for Stuck Commit Queues
Description: Add an alert when a queue gets stuck.    As a possible implementation, since we log when an item is enqueued, if when adding an item to a queue the item at the head of the queue has been on the queue for a long time we know the queue is stuck and can trigger a Splunk alert.

The resulting run didn't respect the order based on the depends_on field. The tasks still appeared in the depends on section, but they weren't run beforehand.    I experienced the same behaviour on multiple attempts.    Sample: [https://evergreen.mongodb.com/version/5d9b46ed2fbabe301b7435f7]

However, this can leave dangling host credentials in the database, which should logically also be deleted with the removed documents.

Description: The {{variants}} flag allows the user to submit a comma-separated list but {{task}} does not.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: scheduler does not schedule all tasks of a single build at the same time
Description: I have a task (stat_check_init) that does the following:  1. goes over all build variants in its version  2. IF for that build variant there are tasks that are not task[activated], skip  3. IF not - create a new task within that variant that depends on all other tasks in that variant  I made sure that stat_check_init depends on all other tasks that have generate tasks in them  but I see now that sometimes, it does not create tasks for some of the variants  for example, variant thirdparty (f4c. Thirdparty Int......) usually has 3 tasks in it, unless stat_check_init creates the fourth:  did create: https://evergreen.mongodb.com/version/mms_6a6463038824dd3405491eb81a435436650ddd65  did not create: https://evergreen.mongodb.com/version/mms_83cfbc131a893b6c31cfff274e843b38e49ede24  I think this is because all tasks in f4c depend on another task.... and until that task is not done - they don't get to the activated status.    (I get the task above with the API call: /v2/builds/{}/tasks)    I clearly see that the cases in which stat_check_init doesn't create the fourth task are cases where it finishes its run BEFORE the other tasks get their schedule time (according to the event logs)

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Add a delete button to a commit queue patch's patch page
Description: Currently if a user has a patch they want to remove from the queue they need to use the CLI. Add a way to remove a patch from the queue through the UI.

Title: add support for tag negations in patch alias selection

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Frozen webpage for task with many tests
Description: The BIC team has some large tasks with many tests, and we find that the task webpage often gets stuck rendering for a long time, sometimes so long that Chrome suggests killing the page (screenshot included below). We noticed that this happens only when the task has failing tests, and that it actually renders quite quickly when the task is passing. Perhaps it's searching for the failing tests to display them at the top of the Tests panel? We could of course split up the task but thought we should flag this as this might be indicative of an issue on your end.    Here's the link to one such task (the one showed in the screenshot): https://evergreen.mongodb.com/task/sqlproxy_full_matrix__os_full_matrix~osx_mongodb_version~latest_mongodb_topology~standalone_module_tests_patch_bb2a884fe1453485ce29f489cca281276862f4e3_5d962ead61837d0adbc54a27_19_10_03_17_23_58##%257B%2522compare%2522%253A%255B%257B%2522hash%2522%253A%2522bb2a884fe1453485ce29f489cca281276862f4e3%2522%257D%255D%257D

When running {{evergreen commit-queue merge}} however it always states {{Finalized: No}} even if the commit is actually queued and will run without any further interaction required on my part. Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Support multiple commits in one batch in commit queue
Description: It's a best practice to separate logically separate code into multiple git commits. It's clearer for readers and easier for partial backport and revert. However, commit queue only supports a single commit and encourage developers to squash commits into larger ones. If the commits are not logically relevant but dependent, they'd have to be pushed separately, one after the other gets merged. SERVER-42219 is an example. The code change broke an unnecessary unrelated test, so it depends on the test removal. Ideally these commits can be pushed together, when one of them failed, either the following commits get rejected or all get rejected as a whole.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: User data hosts should be terminated if the DNS name is not set
Description: If the setup host job does not run or it fails to get the DNS name for the host, the host should be terminated. Otherwise, the agent monitor (which will start sometime after the host is spawned) cannot be contacted at all and will repeatedly attempt to contact the server and there is no way for the app server to terminate it since it needs an IP to contact the Jasper service.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: New expiry selector does not provide useful information
Description: It allows me to pick arbitrary dates but the validation rules prevent me from picking one that's too far in the future. The old style provided this guidance by saying Extend by Some Valid Value.    The date picker should not show me dates I cannot actually select or should indicate what the valid values are in some way.     !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Validate instance type when creating/modifying spawn host
Description: Currently, the create and modify spawn host commands do not check whether the specified instance type is a valid one (even though the EC2 API should return an error in this case). It might be a good idea to have a list of allowed instance types for the EC2 provider and validate the instance type field when creating or modifying hosts.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Fix macos distro name in self-tests
Description: macos-1014-i7 should be macos-1014

Title: Save/log termination reason when requesting to terminate a host
Description: To aid in troubleshooting

Name: The MongoDB Engineering

Description: The agent might start before the provisioning setup host job has run.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Refactor scheduler-related database model
Description: Create discrete sub-documents within the distro document to contain stage specific fields:   # finder_settings   # planner_settings   # dispatcher_settings   # host_allocator_settings (while not scheduler specific, this information is currently defined within the catch-all _planner_settings_ sub-document )

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: commit queue patches use an outdated project config
Description: Because we cache projectConfig we don't update it when a commit queue patch comes to the front of the queue. It's set when the patch is created and then never updated.  If a patch is enqueued and the project config is updated in an intervening commit the old config will be used when the patch is tested.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Host Jasper service should read splunk credentials from a file
Description: Jasper should instead read the token from a file.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Hosts can leak in create host job
Description: One host started successfully in the host create job but for some reason, the app server never ran the setup host job on it and the host intent document doesn't exist (e.g. it may have been removed), preventing the app server from being able to stop the agent monitor (since the IP is taken from the host document and the setup host job must run in order to get the IP addres from EC2).     It seems that if the create host job fails after the cloud manager spawns the host, the host is leaked and never terminated despite the fact that it may have actually started.    There also seems to be an issue with multiple createt host jobs running simultaneously and creating multiple hosts from a single intent host (e.g. {{evg-rhel62-large-20190927045902-7097260184595140677}}).

Name: The MongoDB Engineering

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Have a way of speeding up a long commit queue.
Description: When the commit queue gets long, it would be nice to be able to change the tasks that are part of the commit queue in order to speed up processing time and clear the queue. However, it appears that tasks for queue items are determined when the user submits the queue entry, so changing items in the queue isn't helpful.    Having some way to quickly drain the queue could be helpful if the queue gets really backed up. Assigning tasks when an entry reaches the head of the queue would provide a way to do that, but if there is another way of solving this that could work as well.

Description: Current new provisioning assumes that all parent directories exist already.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: depends on with all three asterisks fails.
Description: when trying to run a patch that contains a task within a variant,  if the task depends on settings are as follows:   depends_on:     - name: *       variant:  *       status: *  the variant doesn't appear in the tasks to run.  even if I check that task in the UI, it will not show up.  this is the command I ran:  evergreen patch -p mms -v evg_foliage,unit_python,unit_js,unit_java,code_health -t all -u  (the task I changed locally is within evg_foliage, it's named stat_check_init. The only change I made is to make the depends on as mentioned above)    here's a link to the patch: https://evergreen.mongodb.com/version/5d7bc47ee3c33105bdfada04    (note, I unscheduled and aborted since this would not help me test the deps, so ignore task failures here)

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: User data provisioning should have deadline
Description: Currently, a host that is provisioning depends on the provisioning host job to try SSHing until it succeeds or uses up all attempts, at which point it is decommissioned and terminated. However, user data independently provisions the host and the app server will not be able to know when provisioning is done unless the agent contacts it. If user data fails (i.e. the agent never contacts the app server), the host should be terminated. Ideally the idle host termination job should catch when the host has been provisioning for too long.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Use cached task group order
Description: EVG-6441 stopped saving full projects to the database by fixing a bug where we should have been saving the parserProject. However, it appears that [calling model.LoadProjectInto|https://github.com/evergreen-ci/evergreen/commit/039d385f79e63472bd660c91afcecbe318be54ee#diff-f6193ab04bcefcdbc748b1761aa54e9dL50] in {{cacheTaskGroups}} occasionally spikes CPU on the application servers. Since we may have been caching task group order elsewhere, we should see if we can use that cached order.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Validate base commit sent to patch-file command
Description: It's currently possible to set {{-b}} of the {{evergreen patch-file}} command to a string that is not a commit in the repository you are patching. This can break the scheduler, because a patch without a base commit does not have the project yaml and therefore cannot sort task groups, for example. Presumably this breaks other parts of the scheduler as well, but sorting task groups happens early so is the thing that visibly breaks.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Task Groups broken for Distro Aliases
Description: The problem (from Brian):   # Host asks for task. There's no task in its distro queue, so we get a task from an alias queue.   # The host finishes the task and asks for another one. In the meantime, tasks have entered the distro queue.   # We iterate over the distro queue, and, having not found a task in the host's current task group, we return a different task.    We should instead check both queues for task group tasks before returning a different task.

Name: The MongoDB Engineering
Title: Add new endpoints for test/task details over x versions
Description: For Foliage, it's required to see how a task performed in some x amount of versions starting from some version Y (or the latest).     Can you add an endpoint that would return a json with:  {    version1 : {<task/test_object>},    version2 : {<task/test_object>},    .....    versionx : {<task/test_object>},  }    the parameters we would need for it to be useful is:  * start_version=<version> (Optional, if not sent, use most recent  * limit=<number-of-versions> (optional, if not sent - have some default)  * variant_name=<The variant where the task lives> (maybe this could be optional and then the return structure is a bit more complex, having variants as the top elements and inside them the versions, and the task/test. If this is too hard, it's less important, normally we would do this per variant, and making this mandatory would be perfectly fine.  * task_name=mandatory - the task name we want to know about  * test name=optional (if none is sent, return the task data, otherwise - return the test data  * pagination support    Note: Another optional argument could be: skip unscheduled versions. That would allow us to make a much smaller amount of calls to evergreen. Every time we check a task/test that runs on a batch timer, we hit plenty of unscheduled versions until we actually get to that X amount of versions with statuses.
